column4: I really want to install Ubuntu, but I'm not the only one who uses this computer so I'd like to keep windows on here.  Would it be easier to make a dual boot, or a virtual ubuntu machine?  Does ubuntu even support a virtual machine inside windows?
well I'd prefer a dual boot, but I'm not sure how to do it with the different disk partitions and all.
Linux will do it for you if you have Windows already installed

if you have a spare partition w/ XP installed already, you can go ahead and install Ubuntu on whatever space you have left, one partition for your / filesystem and one for Swap Space, much like Windows's Page file
